title: Hojo Undo (補助運動)
description: Traditional strength training of Goju-ryu Karate-do

equipment.title: Equipment
equipment.overviewDescription: Overview of all traditional training tools

chiIshi.name: Chi Ishi
chiIshi.description: Stone lever weight for wrist and grip strength

nigiriGame.name: Nigiri Game
nigiriGame.description: Gripping jars for finger and hand strength

kongoken.name: Kongoken
kongoken.description: Iron oval for total body conditioning

ishiSashi.name: Ishi Sashi
ishiSashi.description: Stone padlocks for grip strength and technique

template.mainComponentsDescription: The key aspects of this training
template.trainingEffectsDescription: What you can expect from this training
template.relatedSectionsDescription: Explore other aspects of Hojo Undo
template.coreTraining: The core of this training is the coordinated use of body, breath and mind.
template.harmonization: This harmonization follows the same principles as the heishugata (Sanchin and Tensho).

strengthExercises.title: Strength Exercises
strengthExercises.subtitle: Traditional Strength Training
strengthExercises.description: Develop functional strength with traditional Hojo Undo tools for effective karate training
strengthExercises.historicalNote: These strength exercises have been passed down from master to student for centuries. They are developed to create functional strength that is directly applicable in karate techniques.
strengthExercises.safetyNotice: Expert guidance is essential for all strength exercises. Always start with light weights and focus on correct technique before increasing intensity.

hardeningExercises.title: Hardening Exercises
hardeningExercises.subtitle: Conditioning and Hardening
hardeningExercises.description: Develop physical and mental resistance with traditional hardening exercises for effective karate training
hardeningExercises.historicalNote: These hardening exercises are developed to prepare the body for the impact of karate techniques. They are essential for developing real fighting power.
hardeningExercises.safetyNotice: Hardening exercises should always be performed under expert guidance. Start carefully and build up gradually to prevent injuries.

physical: Strengthening of wrist and hand muscles
Improvement of shoulder and arm strength
Strengthening of finger and hand muscles

training: Weight can be adjusted to level

common.learnFundamentals: Learn about the fundamentals and philosophy
common.buildMaintain: How to build and maintain the equipment

function.title: Chi Ishi Function
function.subtitle: Function
function.description: The chi ishi is a 'stone lever weight'. It is still used in China, among others in the province of Fuzhou.

forearmStrength.title: Strengthens forearm and hand muscles
forearmStrength.subtitle: Strengthens forearm and hand muscles
items: Support of wrist stability in punching and striking techniques
Strengthening of grip for close combat techniques
Improvement of hand coordination and control
Development of finger and hand muscles

chinkuchiPower.title: Development of chinkuchi kakin power
chinkuchiPower.subtitle: Development of chinkuchi kakin power
items: Squeezing the stick at the end of movements
Concentration of power in specific points

breathingCoordination.title: Breathing coordination
breathingCoordination.subtitle: Breathing coordination
items: Coordination of body, breath and mind

principles: Coordination of body, breath and mind
Technique is more important than weight

construction.label: Construction
construction.description: Learn how to make a Chi Ishi

function.historicalNote: The Chi Ishi originates from China and is still used in the province of Fuzhou. It is one of the oldest Hojo Undo tools and is essential for traditional karate training.
function.safetyNotice: Expert guidance is essential for Chi Ishi training. Always start with light weights and focus on correct technique before increasing intensity.

construction.title: Chi Ishi Construction
construction.subtitle: Construction
construction.description: Learn how to make a traditional Chi Ishi with the right materials and techniques
principles: Ensure solid attachment of all parts
Test the construction thoroughly before use
Check regularly for wear and damage
Adjust weight to your training level
Store the Chi Ishi in a dry, safe place

function.label: Function
function.description: Learn about the functions of the Chi Ishi

construction.historicalNote: Traditionally, Chi Ishi were made from natural materials that were locally available. Modern versions often use concrete or granite for the weight, but the basic construction remains the same.
construction.safetyNotice: Make sure all parts are firmly attached before using the Chi Ishi. Check regularly for wear and replace damaged parts immediately.

attentionPoints.title: Chi Ishi Attention Points
attentionPoints.subtitle: Attention Points
attentionPoints.description: Important attention points for safe and effective Chi Ishi training

safetyMeasures.title: Safety Measures
safetyMeasures.subtitle: Safety Measures
items: Check the construction before each training

technicalFocusPoints.title: Technical Focus Points
technicalFocusPoints.subtitle: Technical Focus Points
items: Keep the back straight during exercises

trainingProgression.title: Training Progression
trainingProgression.subtitle: Training Progression
items: First increase the number of repetitions

principles: Technique is more important than weight

function.label: Function
function.description: Learn about the functions of the Chi Ishi

construction.label: Construction
construction.description: Learn how to make a Chi Ishi

attentionPoints.historicalNote: Traditionally, these attention points were passed down orally from master to student. They are based on centuries of experience and are essential for safe training.
attentionPoints.safetyNotice: Expert guidance is essential for Chi Ishi training. Always start under the supervision of an experienced instructor and stop immediately at pain or discomfort.

exercises.title: Chi Ishi Exercises
exercises.subtitle: Exercises
exercises.description: Learn effective exercises with the Chi Ishi for strength development and technique improvement

basicExercises.subtitle: Basic Exercises
items: Chi Ishi Uke - Blocking with weight

Chi Ishi Uchi - Striking with weight

function.title: Nigiri Game Function
function.subtitle: Function
function.description: Discover the functions and benefits of the traditional Nigiri Game in karate training
principles: Start with light weights and gradually build up
Combine with other Hojo Undo exercises

construction.label: Construction
construction.description: Learn how to make Nigiri Game jars

function.historicalNote: The Nigiri Game is of Chinese origin and was traditionally used for developing grip strength. The jars were filled with sand or gravel to adjust the weight.
function.safetyNotice: Expert guidance is essential for Nigiri Game training. Always start with light weights and focus on correct technique before increasing weight.

construction.title: Nigiri Game Construction
construction.subtitle: Construction
construction.description: Learn how to make traditional Nigiri Game jars with the right materials and techniques

materials.title: Materials
materials.subtitle: Materials
items: Clay or ceramics for the jars

principles: Store in a dry, safe place

function.label: Function
function.description: Learn about the functions of the Nigiri Game

construction.historicalNote: Traditionally, Nigiri Game jars were made from clay and filled with sand or gravel. Modern versions often use ceramics or concrete for durability.
construction.safetyNotice: Make sure the jars are solid before using them. Check regularly for cracks and replace damaged jars immediately.
